fields.description:
Right now, administrators can not change ownership of a filter to an user that is not within the filter shares permissions. This is a limitation that can prevent some administrators from changing ownership of filters due to company limitations in adding / modifying users from groups when using external user management.

So for this request, we should have a way for system administrators to override this and change the ownership and modify the shares.
fields.summary: Allow system administrators to change filter shares

fields.description:
*Use case / Scenario*

A user is granted the permission to administer a JIRA project (via the Project Administrator role), but is not granted the JIRA Administrator role.

The problem with this type of permission is that the user can't view the full list of workflows that are available in JIRA. The only thing that the user can do when going to the page *Projects > Workflows* is view and edit the workflows from the workflow scheme that is already associated to the project.

This user can't do the following:
- change the workflow scheme associate to the project
- view the whole list of workflow which already exists in JIRA

 !Screen Shot 2019-01-04 at 11.08.22 AM.png|thumbnail! 


*Suggestion*

Allow any project admin user which does not have the JIRA admin permission to do the following:
- change the workflow scheme associate to the project
- view the whole list of workflow which already exists in JIRA
fields.summary: Allow non JIRA Admin users to view the whole list of available workflows

fields.description: It would be great if JIRA is able to Restrict Comment Visibility based on commenting user's roles automatically.
fields.summary: JIRA Restrict Comment Visibility By User's Role Which Commenting Automatically

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using Quick Search to search for a text that contains a hyphen, for example,  "RH-DB-IBM-01", quick search will stop searching when "-" is typed into the search bar. 
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create an issue with the Summary "RH-DB-IBM-01".
 # Create another issue with called "Quick Search" with the description " "RH-DB-IBM-01"
 # Head to the Quick Search bar, then search for "RH-DB-IBM-01". No results are shown.
 # Head to Advanced Search, run the JQL query : 

{code:java}
 text ~ "RH-DB-IBM-01" {code}
Results will be shown.
h3. Expected Results

Issues that contains hyphens in their text will be returned in the Quick Search Results.
h3. Actual Results

Issues that contain hyphens are not returned in the search results.
h3. Note

Result will be returned when "RH-" is typed in the search result.
fields.summary: When searching for text that includes a hyphen, search results are not shown in Quick Search

fields.description:
Currently, when a cascading custom field is used, there is no a description on/next to the options drop-down list:

!Screen Shot 2019-01-03 at 14.10.51.png!

The need by the customer is to set a description for each option on the drop-down list.
fields.summary: To set a label name for cascading custom field option

fields.description:
h3. Problem

If a cache replication queue is corrupted when a node is shutting down, then on the next node start Jira will try to open this queue file every time it is required (a cache replication message is being send to another node on this particular channel = file). If the existing file is corrupted it fails with the following error:
{code}
ERROR      [c.a.j.c.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheManager] Error when creating cache replication queue for node: [node_name]. This node will be inconsistent. Error: File is corrupt; length stored in header is 0.{code}
This results in:
 * cache replication message not being delivered
 * leak of file descriptor 
** Jira hits into "Too many open files" error. Reviewing lsof output points to many localq entries.

h3. Desired Jira behaviour

If the file is corrupted backup this file (copy with corrupted_ prefix) and create a new file.

h3. Workaround

Delete the corrupted queue file. Step to identify the corrupted file can be found following [comment-1917799|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-68653?focusedCommentId=1917799&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1917799]
It should not be necessary to shut down this node. It should recreate this queue file automatically.
fields.summary: Asynchronous cache replication queue - leaking file descriptor when queue file corrupted

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira 7.13.1 and 8.0.0 will have default ports specified for a node to node communications. This work is done in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66608

We improved the doc previously in [JRASERVER-64976|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64976] to include the parameter to a specific Object port. It comes to the point that this will now be the default and additional configuration is optional.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the documentation ([Installing Jira Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/installing-jira-data-center-938846870.html]) to explicitly mention opening two ports between the nodes
* Ehcache port default 40001
* Object port default 40011

This is *best* to be mentioned early in subtopics of the following
* Before you begin > What are the prerequisites?
* 3. Configure your existing Jira instance to work in a cluster

h3. Why this is important
Jira DC requires these ports to be open and reachable between nodes to ensure node-to-node communications.
fields.summary: Improve Jira DC documentation to explicitly mention Communication ports

fields.description:
Currently in Jira 7.3.3 Jira when restarted or stopped doesn't log any information to the Windows Event Viewer as a Service. The information is logged if there is a service start/stop issue reporting the error however nothing if the start/stop is successful.

This is a problem since there is no information about who stopped/started Jira.
fields.summary: Jira Windows Service no longer reports in Event Viewer Windows logs start/stop

fields.description:
h1. Issue

Using Organizations is tough because of the following issues.
 - Organizations have to be maintained manually in JIRA. We are a very large enterprise with 10k user licenses for JIRA. Creating JIRA Customer Organizations would be a duplication of data (taking into account we already have hundreds of email and security groups set up in Active Directory)

 - Automatic sharing of a ticket with an Organization happens only if the user belongs to only one organization. 

 - Our customers specify the group they want to share with by adding email distribution groups to the CC field of the email they use to submit the case. We need JIRA to recognize the entries in the CC field and look up not just user emails to add Participants, but also User Group emails and add those group emails as participants, and then actually send notifications to those group emails just like it would to a user email.

h1. Suggestion
 - Make Service Desk tickets available to multiple users based on a specification of a recognized (by JIRA) User Group

 - Make JIRA issue-creation-from-email capable of recognizing Email Distribution lists added to the CC of an incoming email, and make the resultant issue visible to the members of the group (where the email address of the group and/or the group name match to a User Group recognized by JIRA)

 - Allow customer to select User Group(s) with whom the ticket should be Shared, through the Service Desk portal

 - Allow for multiple User Groups' members to have visibility on an issue in this solution

 - Support sending issue-related email to the group members, identically to how emails would be sent to Request Participants
fields.summary: Improving Jira Service Desk Organizations

fields.description:
h3. Current Behavior

After deleting a custom field, one or more nodes in JIRA Data Center show NullPointerException when searching for issues or when viewing issues.
 * NullPointerException may occur on other pages as well.

Example stacktrace:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:104)
    at com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCache.get(DeferredReplicationCache.java:48)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.persistence.CachedFieldConfigSchemePersister.getConfigSchemesForCustomField(CachedFieldConfigSchemePersister.java:100)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.manager.FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.getConfigSchemesForField(FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.java:48)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.getConfigurationSchemes(ImmutableCustomField.java:1222)
    at com.atlassian.jira.jql.permission.CustomFieldClausePermissionChecker.hasPermissionToUseClause(CustomFieldClausePermissionChecker.java:44)
    at com.atlassian.jira.jql.permission.DefaultClausePermissionHandler.hasPermissionToUseClause(DefaultClausePermissionHandler.java:46)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.managers.DefaultSearchHandlerManager.getVisibleClauseHandlers(DefaultSearchHandlerManager.java:186)
    at com.atlassian.jira.web.component.jql.DefaultAutoCompleteJsonGenerator.getVisibleFieldNamesJson(DefaultAutoCompleteJsonGenerator.java:70)
...
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.persistence.FieldConfigSchemePersisterImpl.lambda$getConfigSchemesForCustomField$0(FieldConfigSchemePersisterImpl.java:202)
    at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:174)
    at java.util.HashMap$ValueSpliterator.forEachRemaining(HashMap.java:1625)
    at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481)
    at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
    at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
    at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:499)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.persistence.FieldConfigSchemePersisterImpl.getConfigSchemesForCustomField(FieldConfigSchemePersisterImpl.java:205)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.persistence.CachedFieldConfigSchemePersister.loadSchemesByCustomFieldId(CachedFieldConfigSchemePersister.java:207)
    at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.getFromLoader(LoadingCache.java:145)
    at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.loadValueAndReleaseLock(LoadingCache.java:100)
    at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.get(LoadingCache.java:76)
    at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:99)
    ... 268 more
{noformat}
h3. Expected Results

Deleting custom field does not cause errors on any node
h3. Cause

The cause is believed to be a race condition where the cache on NPE nodes reference a custom field that no longer exists.
h3. Environment

JIRA Data Center with two or more nodes
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Set breakpoint in DefaultSearchHandlerManager.java#getVisibleClauseHandlers
 ** Line 186, pause thread
 # Attempt to add issue link - From an issue, add link then add by searching for issues (so that JQL autocomplete will be retrieved)
 ** Breakpoint is it.
 # On another node, delete custom field
 # On paused node, flush caches
 # Mute breakpoints, run
 ** Stacktrace in logs, unable to use JQL autocomplete

h3. Workaround

Nodes showing NullPointerException will need to be restarted or have caches flushed. NullPointerException should not appear after restart.
 * Success has been reported when using ScriptRunner to flush caches
 ** /plugins/servlet/scriptrunner/admin/builtin/exec/com.onresolve.scriptrunner.canned.jira.admin.ClearCaches
 * NullPointerException that continues after restart indicates a different problem is occurring
fields.summary: After successfully deleting custom fields on Jira Data Center some operations may result on NullPointerException on some nodes of the cluster

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Detailed view of issue search can break when it's initially loaded data has issue with summary containing any of characters not passing given regex:
{noformat}
/^(?:\{.*\}|\[.*\])$/
{noformat}
This includes (html encoded):
 * {{&\#8232;}} ("  ")
 * {{&\#8233;}} ("  ")

h3. Environment
 * Google Chrome
 * Jira 7.13.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create issue with summary containing character  " "
 2. Go to
{noformat}
<Jira>/issues/?jql=reporter%20%3D%20currentUser()%20ORDER%20BY%20createdDate%20DESC
{noformat}
h3. Expected Results

Issue search loads without any problems.
h3. Actual Results

Issue search shows only site header and column with issues, while sidebar and issue view are blank white.
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-03 at 13.48.17.png|thumbnail!

Javascript error can be seen in the console:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot set property 'table' of undefined
    at Object.b [as readInitialData] (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&baseurl-check-resources=true&healthcheck-resources=true&is-server-instance=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira.create.linked.issue=true&locale=en-PL&nps-acknowledged=true&nps-not-opted-out=true&richediton=true&spectrum=true&user-logged-in=true:6879)
    at HTMLDocument.<anonymous> (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&baseurl-check-resources=true&healthcheck-resources=true&is-server-instance=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira.create.linked.issue=true&locale=en-PL&nps-acknowledged=true&nps-not-opted-out=true&richediton=true&spectrum=true&user-logged-in=true:8568)
    at j (batch.js?locale=en-PL&spectrum=true:66)
    at Object.fireWith (batch.js?locale=en-PL&spectrum=true:67)
    at Function.ready (batch.js?locale=en-PL&spectrum=true:55)
    at HTMLDocument.Q (batch.js?locale=en-PL&spectrum=true:65)
{noformat}
h3. Notes

The problem exists because jQuery used in Jira 7 (1.7.2) doesn't parse JSON object when extracting it from DOM via [.data() method|https://api.jquery.com/data/#data-html5] if it doesn't pass the test on regexp mentioned above. Jira code relies on the object to be parsed and doesn't check if the parsing happened correctly.

Issue should be fixed in jQuery 1.8.1 and above: [https://bugs.jquery.com/ticket/10863]
h3. Workaround

Use the site header to navigate to: Issues -> Current Search

Identified issues can be located via SQL; here's a PostgreSQL example for the two characters mentioned above:
{code:sql}
SELECT
  p.pkey || '-' || ji.issuenum AS issue_key,
  ENCODE(ji.summary::bytea,'escape') AS issue_summary
FROM jiraissue ji
INNER JOIN project p
  ON ji.project = p.id
WHERE
  ji.summary LIKE U&'%\2028%'
OR
  ji.summary LIKE U&'%\2029%';
{code}
fields.summary: New line character in issue summary can break issue search detailed view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
AWS template doesn't add the parameters relaxedPathChars and relaxedQueryChars to the connector on port 8443

h3. Environment
AWS templates available at https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment/src

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Deploy the template https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment/src/master/templates/JiraDataCenter.template.yaml
# Attempt to access a node on port 8443

h3. Expected Results
The parameters {{relaxedPathChars="[]|"}} and {{relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>"}} are added to all connectors.

h3. Actual Results
The parameters {{relaxedPathChars="[]|"}} and {{relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>"}} are only added to the connector on port 8080, while the connector on port 8443 does not have these parameters added. Therefore, Jira is not accessible on port 8443.

h3. Workaround
Manually add the parameters {{relaxedPathChars="[]|"}} and {{relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>"}} to the connector on port 8443.

h3. Notes
Originally reported at https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment/issues/10/jira-templates-missing-required-7123
fields.summary: AWS template doesn't add the parameters relaxedPathChars and relaxedQueryChars to the connector on port 8443

When passing this through the importer that use Basic authentication, it will cause the error in *Steps 2*. h3. Expected Results JIRA will bypass the Basic authentication and used the token provided by AWS URL to transfer attachment over. h3. Actual Results JIRA will still use a Basic authentication and will cause the error in *Steps 2*. h3. Workaround * Upload the attachment using [Importing data from CSV \- Importing attachments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html#ImportingdatafromCSV-Importingattachments]. * Move the attachments from the AWS to a local server that will allow a Basic authentication.
fields.summary: JIRA Importer for Redmine to bypass basic authentication when it get redirected

fields.description:
As Service desk agent I would like to create new linked issue (in different Jira Core/ Jira Service Desk project) using mobile application.

As of now I could link issues, but not creating new linked issues.

New linked issues should get all projects and custom fields as in WEB screen.

Business scenario:

I receive issues in Service Desk (one project only) by my customers. As an agent I distribute these issues to different projects (including Jira Core) for further processing by consultants and technical teams. This operation I perform as "create new linked issue" into other projects.
fields.summary: Create linked issue by mobile application

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an issue is deleted on one node, it can still appear in searches on some other node. The key and summary of the issue are visible, but after clicking on the issue they change to "This issue can no longer be opened" message.

This happens when an "UPDATE" replication event is placed into the database after a "DELETE" event *and* they are processed in the immediate following batches by the node.
 For example, with the following database entries, if one batch is processed at 20:22:48, it will reply the DELETE event, and then the next batch will process the UPDATE event, reviving the deleted issue.
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-02 at 10.34.23.png|thumbnail!  

In production instances, this usually happens due to some automation performing very quick operations, e.g. changing the issue's description and immediately deleting it.
 Sometimes this can lead to the DELETE event being stored in the database before the UPDATE event that was performed earlier.
 Even though both of the operations will be added to the database milliseconds apart, with some unlucky timing they can be processed in separate batches, as described above.
h3. Environment

Jira Data Center
h3. Steps to Reproduce

It's very hard to reproduce this in the UI. The easiest way is to create the scenario directly in the database.
 1. Create some test issue and grab its id (e.g. by running select on the _jiraissue_ table), here it's 10005
 2. Delete the issue from the database:
{code:java}
delete from jiraissue where id = 10005;
{code}
3. Create a DELETE replication event, like the one below. Note that the node's id (_c44634_) has to belong to a running node, and the operation's id (_11035_) needs to be larger than the last processed replication event from that node.
{code:java}
insert into REPLICATEDINDEXOPERATION values (11035, now(), 'c44634', 'ISSUE', 'NONE', 10005, 'DELETE', '');
{code}
4. After ~5 seconds, create an UPDATE replication event, with the same constraints as above. Waiting too little can make this event be processed in the same batch as the previous event, or 2 batches later - in both of those scenarios the bug seems to not be reproducible.
{code:java}
insert into REPLICATEDINDEXOPERATION values (11036, now(), 'c44634', 'ISSUE', 'NONE', 10005, 'UPDATE', '');
{code}
h3. Expected Results

The issue does not appear in the search results.
 Nice to have: some message is logged in the application's log about the race occurring.
h3. Actual Results

The issue's key and summary are visible in searches. Users are unable to view issue details.
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-02 at 10.30.26.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

To fix the index inconsistency, run a project reindex, or a full reindex.

[How to remove from Jira lucene index, issues that have been deleted in the database, but still present in index|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-remove-from-jira-lucene-index-issues-that-have-been-deleted-in-the-database-but-still-present-in-index-998896911.html] offers a workaround that does not require a project or full re-index. 

The the occurrences can also be limited by modifying automation scripts to avoid updating issues right before deleting them.
fields.summary: Deleted issues can be shown in searches in Jira DC

 # Create a project

the creator and reporter fields should be the same as the source instance the reporter should be User B and the creator User A

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira doesn't allow to restore data (projects, issues, workflows, etc) without touching the instance settings such as authentication, external directories, etc.

h3. Suggested Solution
There could be an option while restoring an XML backup to only import data without changing the instance settings.

h3. Why this is important
Some companies prefer pre-configuring an environment to confirm settings are working fine and only then import the data.

h3. Workaround
Set up the Jira instance first, then use the *Project import* functionality to bring all needed data.
fields.summary: Allow for backup restore to replace only data, not instance settings

h3. Issue Summary

If we create an issue from the top bar after session is expired, no error message is shown on the UI and the browser keeps loading forever.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Login Jira
# Wait 1 minute
# Press {{Create}} button on the top bar to create an issue

"User session was expired." or something like the error should be shown on the UI.

h3. Actual Results

No error message was shown on the UI and the browser keeps loading.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It's typical to have a Confluence page with a certain number of child pages, each with a certain number of JIRA issues. When deleting the parent page choosing to delete the child pages altogether, Confluence will send a huge number of requests to JIRA for deleting the issue links. This will cause JIRA to stall for a certain amount of time.

Example:
# Create a page with 50 child pages
# For each child page, mention 20 unique JIRA issues
# Delete the parent page and choose to delete all the child pages
# Confluence will send 50 * 20 = 1000 DELETE requests to JIRA like this:
{code}
127.0.0.1 1346x24774x2 admin [26/Dec/2018:22:26:07 +0800] "DELETE /jira790/rest/api/latest/issue/PUB-992/remotelink?globalId=appId%3Ddb73d65e-9dd8-3d71-a88a-c5504a978829%26pageId%3D3670036&xoauth_requestor_id=admin HTTP/1.1" 204 - 1026 "-" "Apache-HttpClient/4.5.5 (Java/1.8.0_181)" "1mm8l02"
{code}

h3. Suggestions
For Atlassian - come up with a better way to handle this scenario, so that JIRA performance won't be noticeably affected.

For JIRA/Confluence end-users - schedule a maintenance window whenever it comes to deleting a page that involves a huge number of JIRA issues.
fields.summary: Deleting Confluence page/s with lots of issue links degrades JIRA performance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we add a Table from the drop down option in the visual mode while updating any issue field (be it comments section) , It adds an extra line after the table and and if we delete the table again in the visual mode, the extra line doesn't go away and it gives a drop down option with nothing listed. 
h3. Environment

Issue reproducible in 7.6.6 and 7.6.9
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a simple text custom field which has Wiki Renderer.
 # Add the custom field to all the screens including edit issue screen.
 # Open any issue from a project. 
 # Click on Edit issue
 # You should be able to see the custom field where you can input anything either in Visual mode or in Text mode
 # Stay on Visual mode and click on drop down box to create a table
 # Save it. 
 # Now click on the edit issue again and in visual mode, delete the table by selecting delete table from the options that you get when you click inside the table
 # You will see that it has not removed the extra space and instead leaved behind a expand or a drop down menu
 # This behaviour is not seen when adding and removing table from Text mode. 

h3. Expected Results

Expected Results, is that when we remove a table from visual section, it should also remove the extra line that it inserted when adding the table.
h3. Workaround

Two Workarounds available :

1) Remove the table from Visual Section and then remove the extra line from text mode. 

2) do a CTL+A (select all) in the visual mode and delete the whole table which also works at the customer side.
fields.summary: Deletion of Table doesn't delete the Extra line

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
JIRA by default is designed to send out email notifications to user's individual email addresses should they be eligible for the notification events. 

It would add to the notification scheme configurability if JIRA is able to send out email notifications to one email address for a group of users rather than sending it out to each of the individual email addresses.

e.g.: If user A, B and C are in a group, any notification event will send email notifications to one email address set for the group.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow groups in notification scheme to receive email notifications from a singular email address.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Notification Scheme condition to allow JIRA to send email notifications to a single email address for a group users

fields.description:
In the documentation [Specifying Field Behavior |https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/specifying-field-behavior-938847255.html], in the section :
{quote}
h3. Hiding or showing a field

If your organization or project has no use for a particular field, you have the option to hide it. Hiding a field will ensure that the the field does not appear on any screens (i.e. issue operation screens, workflow transition screens) where the field configuration applies.

(i) *Please note:*
 * Hiding a field in the field configuration is distinct from not adding a field to a screen. Fields hidden through the field configuration will be hidden in _all_ applicable screens, regardless of whether or not they have been added to the screen.
 * For fields that have a default value: If the field is hidden in the field configuration, then it will not receive a value when an issue is created, regardless of whether the field is present on the [*Create Issue* screen(s)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/defining-a-screen-938847288.html]. (The following fields can have a default value: [resolution|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/defining-resolution-field-values-938847105.html], [status|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/defining-status-field-values-938847108.html], [priority|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/defining-priority-field-values-938847101.html], [issue type|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/defining-issue-type-field-values-938847087.html], [security level|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-issue-level-security-938847117.html], and [custom fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/adding-a-custom-field-938847222.html].)
 * The fields *Summary* and *Issue Type* cannot be hidden and as such there is no *Hide* option available for these fields.
 * If you hide the *Fix Version/s* field, the Change Log report will not work.{quote}
Please add that when a field is hidden, it will not be searchable in both Advanced Searching and Basic Searching.
fields.summary: Add in documentation Specifying Field Behavior that a field will not be searchable when hidden

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When searching for a hidden field in Advanced Search, the JQL query shows that the hidden field are searchable, however, this should not be the case as hidden fields are not supposed to show. Basic search does not allow hidden fields to be searchable.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test project 'TEST', assign the issue to an assignee 'testuser'.
 # Hide the field assignee.
 # Using Advanced Search, search :
{code:java}
project = 'test' AND assignee = 'testuser'
{code}

 # Click on Search.

h3. Expected Results

The Advanced Search should be shown as  !error.PNG|thumbnail!  and the warning message 'hidden field is not searchable' as the field is hidden and there will be no results returned.
h3. Actual Results

The Advanced Search will be shown as correct  !green tick.PNG|thumbnail! and user can proceed to search. This should not be the case as search with hidden field will not return any results.
h3. Note

If value is already added to the field before hiding it, results will be shown when performing an Advanced Search if re-indexing is not performed.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Hidden fields should not be searchable when using Advanced Search

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when Jira Datacente node is shutdown while running FullReindex task (see related JRASERVER-47045, JRASERVER-66204), there is no way to remove this task from the cluster. All other nodes still think the task is running even the node is down, so this prevents corresponding operations to be done. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Jira system admin to delete stale FullReindex task. 

h3. Implemented Solution
* (i) Before using this feature, please check if JRASERVER-68885 fits your needs as it's a much simpler and safer option.
* In order to remove stale re-index job from a cluster you can use REST API call (JIRA _Sysadmin_ permission required):
** Method: DELETE
** URL: {{<JIRA>/rest/internal/2/reindex/unlock}}
* It will try to find active foreground re-index task and remove it if it belongs to +OFFLINE+ node.
** (!) Since call removes only re-index task (which is assumed to be stuck), and doesn't kill the re-index thread itself, make sure that an actual node went down before you use this API (to ensure safety, there is also a check in the code).
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: As an JIRA Datacenter Administrator I want to delete reindexing task from offline node

fields.description:

When migrating Jira to another server, it is required to copy over the attachment folder from old instance to new instance. fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The documentation around support for the AWS Quickstart template is confusing around what is supported. 
{quote}Since we wanted to create a quick implementation, the Quick Start doesn't allow the same level of customization as in the case of manual installation. It should be treated as a reference implementation that shows how JIRA Data Center can be used with AWS, and be either used as-is, or serve as an example for creating your own template. {quote}
??[Getting started with Jira Data Center on AWS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/getting-started-with-jira-data-center-on-aws-861253115.html]??

h3. Suggested Solution
As this is similar to using the H2 database for Jira server, we should update our documentation to reflect that the template is for evaluation use only and we recommend to change this to a supported database collation for production use. 

e.g. {quote}JIRA ships with a built-in database (H2). While this database is suitable for evaluation purposes, we strongly recommend that you configure JIRA to use an external database.{quote} 
??[Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/supported-platforms-861253018.html]??
fields.summary: Update Jira AWS Quickstart support information regarding RDS.

fields.description: There is a link in the windows installer to "How to Install JIRA as a Service", the link is currently broken.

h2. Description
Currently, applinks need to be manually added on an instance whenever a new environment is setup. This causes extra costs to organizations that need to have instances that need programmatic setup.

h2. Suggested Solution
Allow application links to be automatically added through configuration files (such as jira-properties)
fields.summary: Ability of automating application links creation

Currently, we have;
 * created (_jira:issue_created_)

events in Jira. It will be nice to have Re-open event as well.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:

When customers connect JIRA to OpenLDAP, in some cases users get randomly disabled and re-enabled after a sync from the OpenLDAP.

The problem usually comes from the fact that the customer has more than 500 users in OpenLDAP, and openLDAP has a default search limit set to 500 users.

Although there is a workaround on the OpenLDAP server side for this issue (which is to increase this limit on the OpenLDAP side), it would be great if we could improve the way JIRA syncs with OpenLDAP, so that the default limit does not cause any sync problem.

h3. Suggestion Solution:

Allow the directory configuration in JIRA to set the maximum limit on the JIRA side instead of the OpenLDAP side.

h3. Workarond

Increase the *olcSizeLimit* limit on the OpenLDAP side to make sure that JIRA can sync more than 500 users.
fields.summary: Provide a way to set the maximum number of results when syncing with OpenLDAP

fields.description:
We're looking for an option to send out an outlook appointment from Jira to a person which is linked in a custom field, without opening outlook.

 

Is there any solution for that problem?

 

kind regards

Patrick
fields.summary: Outlook appointment sent from Jira

fields.description:
Jira is becoming a more common platform than ever and it is more and more common to see plugins that "depend on" or "integrate with" other plugins. Universal Plugin Manager (UPM) should also consider and manage these dependencies. For example if plugin A is dependent on plugin B:
 * While publishing plugin A in the marketplace we should be able to declare compatibility with plugin B. This declaration should also contain version detail (just like we declare compatibility with specific Jira versions). 
 * When starting Jira, UPM should load plugins in an order that respects the dependency chain.
 * While searching for add-ons through admin screens the UPM should show the version of plugin A that is compatible with the installed version of plugin B. (just like it shows the version of A that is compatible with your Jira)
 * While uninstalling (or upgrading or disabling) plugin B from a system, it should warn about plugin A being dependent on plugin B.
fields.summary: UPM should manage cross-plugin dependencies

fields.description:
h2. Bug report

There is a small typo in all the configuring time tracking docs: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-time-tracking-938847808.html]
  
  
{quote}[Time Reports|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212077/time-reports?hosting=server&tab=overview]: Flexible time tracking and reporting of time spent on projects, epics, or initiatives broken down by days, users, or issue stases
{quote}
 
  
 at the very bottom of the page, ‘stases’ should be ‘statuses’

 
h2. Content design notes

Presumably, need to make sure that the typo is fixed in the master spaces so it doesn't keep reoccurring. I fixed it on the published space.
fields.summary: Typo: "status" is misspelled in docs

fields.description:
h3. Problem
REST search endpoint used to be slow. However it got even slower somewhere between 7.6.10 and 7.13.0

Even single calls take ~1700 ms on 7.6.10:
 !image-2018-12-07-16-21-46-028.png|thumbnail! 
while it's above 2000ms on 7.13:
 !image-2018-12-07-16-21-15-722.png|thumbnail! 

When doing proper performance test it shows regression is ~25%:
 !image-2018-12-07-16-24-15-846.png|thumbnail! 

The content of response differs by 100 lines out of 78k lines of response:
 !image-2018-12-07-16-20-52-953.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Cause
By default, if no fields are specified when searching via REST, all fields are returned.  As of Jira 7.7, the "Development" field was introduced to provide the ability for users to search information related to the Development Panel.  The result is that this field is included whenever REST searches are performed and causing the longer response times.

h3. Workarounds
When performing REST api searches, ensure to specify the fields:
* Request fields without "Development" custom field. Example:
{code}
{base_url}/rest/api/2/search?jql=text%20~%20task\&fields=summary,description,reporter,assignee
{code}

When performing searches via the UI, an admin can remove the "Development" field from the system default:
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-06 at 11.37.24.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Development field causes slower REST search performance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using REST API to [get a project version|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.13.0/#api/2/project-getProjectVersions], we get these:
{code}
"startDate":"2018-12-01"
"releaseDate":"2018-12-31"
"userStartDate":"01/dic/18"
"userReleaseDate":"31/dic/18"
{code}
* startDate and releaseDate are in universal format regardless of user language
* userStartDate and userReleaseDate follows the user language

However, when configuring a WebHook to be triggered when a version is released, we only get userStartDate and userReleaseDate in localized format which are trickier to handle:
bq. Some of our system admins are in different countries, so they will have different national language preferences, resulting in different month names.

(i) It seems the localized format varies depending on the profile language of the admin that creates the WebHook.
(flag) This may affect all Version related events (not tested).

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Log in JIRA as an admin that uses Italian language
# Create a WebHook for Version Released
# Release a version to trigger the WebHook

h3. Expected behavior
The JSON body contains startDate, releaseDate, userStartDate, and userReleaseDate similar to the REST API mentioned above.

h3. Actual behavior
The JSON body only contains userStartDate and userReleaseDate with the month in Italian.

h3. Workaround
Configure the *Day/Month/Year Format* from *Look and feel* to use *YYYY-MM-dd*. This is not ideal when:
bq. Also, we want a number of different JIRA systems (including some not owned by us) to send data to the same webhook endpoint. We can't insist on all users across all those systems having the same date/time format and primary language.
fields.summary: WebHooks for Version Released should contain startDate and releaseDate

fields.description:
If you are using a language where comma is the decimal separator and dot is the group (or thousands) separator, and you enter a numeric value (like when work is logged) using the group separator in any part of the number, Jira will accept the number ignoring the group separator. This also applies for the dot where dot is the group separator and the comma is the decimal separator. This behavior can be confusing and cause customers to log time in the incorrect format. See example  !logged work.PNG|thumbnail!

The suggested solution is to prevent the value from being accepted when it contains a group separator, indicating that it is not a valid value.
fields.summary: Prevent using invalid group/decimal separator when entering numeric values

fields.description:
Currently the user language sets the decimal separator. It would be useful to retain the current behavior and on top of it allow:
* Allow administrators to set a default decimal separator for all users.
* Allow each user to set their own decimal separator from their profile, independently from their selected language.

In this way, for example, users would be able to switch to English, and still use comma as a decimal separator.

Additionally, this request is also linked to [JRASERVER-68600 Prevent using group separator when entering numeric values|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-68600].
fields.summary: Allow configuring decimal separator

fields.description:
In JIRA, it's currently possible to use the IN operator for Parent Links in JQL.

 

Example:

"Parent Link" in ( EPIC-1, EPIC-2)

 

However, it does not support Not IN operator.

 

Example:

"Parent Link" NOT in ( EPIC-1, EPIC-2)

 

The purpose is to have a quick filter enabled on our boards to hide/show relevant epics.
fields.summary: "Not IN" Operator for Parent Link in JQL

fields.description:

In some cases due to automation errors, there could be too many files attached to the issues.
This creates rendering problems and also might cause disk space usage problems.

h3. Suggested Solution

* Allow this limit to be configurable through jira.properties 
 
h3. Workaround 
None

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using Jira's WYSIWYG editor and finishing a sentence with an URL followed by a character (e.g. https://www.atlassian.com.), Jira will include the dot at the URL.

h3. Suggested Solution

When pasting links, ensure that Jira won't add any characters at the URL.

h3. Why this is important

It will ensure that our WYSIWYG editor can be used more efficiently

h3. Workaround

Using https://www.atlassian.com/. instead won't cause the same behavior.
fields.summary: Typing after pasting a link in the WYSIWG editor will add extra characters at the link

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition 

Jira only allows for one Epic Issue type.
h3. Suggested Solution

Users would like the ability to duplicate the issue type and rename it.
h3. Why this is important

Like cloning a ticket, it allows us to customize at the project level instead of the global level. For example, changing the icon reflects globally.
fields.summary: Allow for multiple Epic Issue Type

fields.description:
When Jira reads the mail Inbox it reads all unread messages. Since many messages get rejected for bulk, auto reply, etc Jira should mark them as read so not to read them again. It would be nice if this could something that the admin could enable/disable as needed.

Maybe even have an option for allow some notification to the administrator on the rejected mail that was marked as read.
fields.summary: When the Jira mail handler reads mail if it rejects any mail it should mark them as read so they are not processed again.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

All of the Option sorters in Jira ignore the fact that a custom field can have multiple contexts.
Because of that, they sort only using a sequence number, sometimes grouping items that shouldn't be grouped, and sometimes incorrectly removing results.

h3. Environment
* Using Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget
* Select List with Multiple contexts

h3. Steps to reproduce

One of the scenarios in which an invalid Option sorter is used:
 # Set up custom field named "New Select", that is a Select List (any type)
 ** Create options A, B in this sequence
 # Create some issues for some project to assign the value
 ** 1 with New select = A
 ** 1 with New select = B
 # Create Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget and point to a filter containing these issues (e.g. _New select is not empty_)
 # Create new context on "New Select" field, name it context "Second context"
 ** Select issue type = any
 ** Select all projects in the project context
 ** Create new options B, C, A in this sequence
 # Create new issues with different values of New Select (B, C, or A)
 # Refresh the gadget

h3. Expected results
All of the values are displayed properly, being grouped by the option's name, even if the options are assigned to a different context

h3. Actual results
The gadget shows weird results, e.g. two rows for the value "B", while there are also issues with values C and A.
fields.summary: Jira incorrectly sorts options from Select List custom fields with multiple contexts in Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As an admin, I’d like to see which users have already approved (or conversely those who are yet to approve) an approval step. 
 Currently when searching through JQL, the approvers can be viewed but there is no way to tell who has approved or not approved the ticket. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to search for this through JQL or a specific report in Service Desk.
fields.summary: I would like a way to search who has (or hasn't) approved a request through JQL

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In Created vs Resolved gadget, when a user clicked on the circle in the graph, it shows the number of issues created/resolved for the particular month (Eg: December). However, this behavior is not documented in [Created vs Resolved Issues Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/created-vs-resolved-issues-report-720416052.html] documentation.

This behavior needs to be documented because users could think that the circle in the graph indicates that there are issues resolved on the last day of the month.

 !Screenshot 2018-12-13 at 9.12.03 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggested Solution

Add explanation in the [Created vs Resolved Issues Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/created-vs-resolved-issues-report-720416052.html] documentation about the function of the circle in the graph.
fields.summary: Update documentation about Created vs Resolved gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, if a user configures the Created vs Resolved gadget, the gadget will display random dates which will be misleading.

+Steps to reproduce+

# Create a filter which contains resolved and newly created issues.
# Add Created vs Resolved gadget in a dashboard.
# Add the newly created filter to the filter. 
3. Set the interval as "Period" as Monthly
4. Set the "Days Previously" as 180 days
5. Save the gadget and we'll see gadget like below:

 !Screenshot 2018-12-13 at 9.12.03 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The dates shown in the x-axis are random and misleading. For example, the 28 December shown in x-axis indicates that there are issues resolved on 28th December. At the time the bug is created (13 December 2018), no issue was created in this date.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.0.10, 7.10.0, 7.12.3, 7.13.0


h3. Expected Results

Each interval in the x-axis should be set as the last day of the month. (Eg: 30/06, 31/07,31/08 etc2)


h3. Actual Results

JIRA is showing random dates in the x-axis.


h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Created and Resolved gadget interval is broken

fields.description:
Hi,
I find it very difficult to link specific attachment to a comment the other user wrote.
We are using the system to report and follow bugs. 
In the process, we upload software versions to be tested and they are usually by the same name and uploaded with comment of how to test the version, Or in other cases the tester upload logs with standard name.
currently I have to check the date and time to link a comment to the attachment.
in case were the ticket is very long it is very problematic.
Tnx Roi.
fields.summary: Attachment link to specific comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A simple JQL like "Issue in (TST-01, TST-02)" that filter two specific issues is recognized as too complex by the board and doesn't pick any specific project workflow to it, bringing all statuses from all workflows of the instance already mapped to the In Progress column. On a big instance, it can get pretty bad to drag all the undesired statuses to the unmapped column.

h3. How to reproduce
Have two issues from a single project TEST that has subtasks from the same project as well. Filter the two issues with the filter:

{code}Issue in (TST-01, TST-02){code}

Create a Kanban board with the filter above. It will load all the statuses from the instance and not only the ones from the workflow of the project TEST.

h3. Desired behaviour
For queries like the one above that specify issues from the same project, it should bring only the statuses from the project's workflow instead of all the statuses of the instance.

h3. Workaround
Remove the column with all the undesired statuses so they will move to the Unmapped Statuses column, and then create a new column again and drags only the statuses you want to it

*or*

Adjust the filter to specify the project as well:

{code}Issue in (TST-01, TST-02) and project = "TEST"{code}

*or* or create a Kanban board specifying the board and not an existent filter.
fields.summary: Kanban board should bring only statuses from the projects workflows of the issues returned by the filter.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For more advanced searching, we would like Jira to add filters according to 'Weeks' without having to put date ranges. This would be like the filter 'startOfWeek' or 'endOfWeek'.
fields.summary: Similar to the JQL filter 'startOfWeek' and 'endOfWeek', Jira should have JQL filter for 'last week','this week' and 'next week'.

fields.description:
h3. Definition
If you set the *Days Previously* field to a larger date span, the X axis of the chart does not show the present date.
!chart.png|thumbnail!

In the above example, the date shown is only up to October 2018 whereas the present date is 12th December. 

h3. Suggestion
Reduce the chart size if the *Days Previously* field has a larger date span to show the date up to the present.
fields.summary: Created vs Resolved Chart to Show the Present Date

fields.description:
h4. Summary

When using CSV import which contains multiple issues to update an issue, issue is moved to a project that it was previously in. For example, issue DEI-1 was moved to USAPI-3. Then, while performing an import, issue is moved back to the project DEI as DEI-3. 
h4. Steps to Reproduce.
 # Head to *Administration > System > Import & Export > External System Import*.
 # Select *CSV* to open the *CSV File import* page.
 # On the *CSV File import* page, select your *CSV Source File*. 
 # Click the *Next* button to proceed to the *Setup project mappings* step of the CSV file import wizard. Map the issue key, comment and summary.

h4. Expected Results

Jira following the issue key will update only the issues specified.
h4. Actual Results

Jira will move issue to the previous project the issue was on and issues will be updated wrongly.
fields.summary: When using CSV import to update an issue, issue is moved to a the old project that it was moved from

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After upgrading an instance from v7.3.8 to v7.12.3, there are some missing custom issue type icons. The app was disabled-enabled and re-installed but that did not fix the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Imported a backup of production to development v7.3.8
# Upgrade Jira from v7.3.8 to v7.12.3 

h3. Expected Results
Icons should be displayed properly

h3. Actual Results
Missing some icons
 !image001.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The following were also tried
- Uploaded new icons file in issue type
- Manually place file (for which we are getting file not found exception) under ../JIRA_HOME../Application Data../avatars 

Uploading icons again fixed _most_ of the screens for our issue types, but still create issue popup couldn't show icons. Other than that, we also re-indexed JIRA but it didn't fix this issue.

Note that other than that after the upgrade, many other icons like project default icon, priority etc. were also missing.
fields.summary: Missing custom issue type icons after upgrade

fields.description:
PostgreSQL 11 has [been released|https://www.postgresql.org/about/news/1894/], but is not a [Supported platform|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html].

Requesting PostgreSQL 11 support.
fields.summary: JIRA support for Postgres 11

fields.description:
When configuring a custom field and choosing projects for a context, users need to press Ctrl to add new projects other than the existing ones.
The risk is where a user clicks on a single project without pressing the Ctrl key, if he clicks Modify, then the context will be applied to this project only and the previous projects/settings will be lost.

This method is very risky when having hundreds of projects as there is no way to revert this action.

 

An improvement would be to have 2 windows; one to add and one to remove projects, similarly to the way members are added removed from Jira groups. This will eliminate the risk.
fields.summary: Change project selection method of "Choose applicable context" in custom fields

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

The customer complained about the overview on top (the error message box) and the error message under each required field feel like a duplicate for them. 

h3. *Suggested Solution*

Add an option for users to turn off the validation error box. 

h3. *Why this is important*
 
The validation error message is a duplicate of the error message already shown under the fields that didn't passed the validation, so they prefer to have a minimalist design with lesser information displayed. 

h3. *Workaround*

As a workaround, I wrote a style script that can be used in the *Administration > System > User Interface > Announcement banner*: 
{code:html} 
<style> 
.aui-message.aui-message-error, form.aui div.error { 
     display: none; 
} 
</style> 
{code} 

h3. *Note* 

* This was tested in JIRA 7.7.0 but it should be the same for other versions as well. 
* No functionalities is lost as well.
fields.summary: The validation error message overview in Issue Screen feel duplicate to the message already exist under the issue field

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

The validation error message in Issue Screen shown the custom field ID despite the custom field name has already been shown. 

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Set up a new project for each (Business, Software, and Service Desk) project type. 
# Add a new custom field of any type. (I used *User Picker (single user)* here)
# Configure some fields (both system and custom field) to be required in these projects. 
# There are two scenarios here: One with the required fields added (affected) and one without. 
# This only affecting the full-page Issue Screen. 

h3. *Expected Results*

Expecting the validation message is shown with only its custom field name just like its counterpart *+without+* the required custom field in the Issue Screen. 
|| Description||Business||Software||Service Desk||
|Without required custom field in the Issue Screen \\ (The required custom field is not added to the screen yet)| *+Page+* \\  !Business-Without-Customfield-In-Screen-Page.png|thumbnail! | *+Page+* \\ !Software-Without-Customfield-In-Screen-Page.png|thumbnail! | *+Page+* \\ !ServiceDesk-Without-Customfield-In-Screen-Page.png|thumbnail! | 

h3. *Actual Results*

|| Description||Business||Software||Service Desk||
|With required custom field in the Issue Screen| *+Page+* \\ !Business-With-Customfield-In-Screen-Page.png|thumbnail! | *+Page+* \\ !Software-With-Customfield-In-Screen-Page.png|thumbnail! | *+Page+* \\ !ServiceDesk-With-Customfield-In-Screen-Page.png|thumbnail! | 
 
h3. *Notes*

* This bug is affecting only the full-page Issue Screen as the popup with the required fields added doesn't show the validation error message box. This is being addressed in another feature request ticket ([JRASERVER-68573|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-68573]) to standardize the validation error message box. 
|| Description||Business||Software||Service Desk||
|With required custom field in the Issue Screen| *+Popup+* \\ !Business-With-Customfield-In-Screen-Popup.png|thumbnail! | *+Popup+* \\ !Software-With-Customfield-In-Screen-Popup.png|thumbnail! | *+Popup+* \\ !ServiceDesk-With-Customfield-In-Screen-Popup.png|thumbnail! | 
* This was tested in JIRA 7.7.0 but it should be the same for other versions as well.
* No functionalities is lost as well.

h3. *Workaround* 

None.
fields.summary: The validation error message in Issue Screen shown the custom field ID despite the custom field name has already been shown

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

The validation error message is not standardized across the Issue Screen components for the full-page and popup. 
* You can see that popup is not showing the message while the full-page does. 
* The system field is omitted in the popup as well when the required field is in the Screen. 

|| Description||Business||Software||Service Desk||
|With required custom field in the Issue Screen| *+Popup+* \\ !Business-With-Customfield-In-Screen-Popup.png|thumbnail! \\ *+Page+* \\ !Business-With-Customfield-In-Screen-Page.png|thumbnail! | *+Popup+* \\ !Software-With-Customfield-In-Screen-Popup.png|thumbnail! \\ *+Page+* \\ !Software-With-Customfield-In-Screen-Page.png|thumbnail! | *+Popup+* \\ !ServiceDesk-With-Customfield-In-Screen-Popup.png|thumbnail! \\ *+Page+* \\ !ServiceDesk-With-Customfield-In-Screen-Page.png|thumbnail! | 
|Without required custom field in the Issue Screen \\ (The required custom field is not added to the screen yet)| *+Popup+* \\ !Business-Without-Customfield-In-Screen-Popup.png|thumbnail! \\ *+Page+* \\  !Business-Without-Customfield-In-Screen-Page.png|thumbnail! | *+Popup+* \\ !Software-Without-Customfield-In-Screen-Popup.png|thumbnail! \\  *+Page+* \\ !Software-Without-Customfield-In-Screen-Page.png|thumbnail! | *+Popup+* \\ !ServiceDesk-Without-Customfield-In-Screen-Popup.png|thumbnail! \\ *+Page+* \\ !ServiceDesk-Without-Customfield-In-Screen-Page.png|thumbnail! | 

h3. *Suggested Solution*

Standardize all the scenarios above to have the validation error message displayed. 

h3. *Why this is important*
 
Customers find it confusing with the different message shown. 

h3. *Workaround*

None. 

h3. *Note* 

* This was tested in JIRA 7.7.0 but it should be the same for other versions as well. 
* No functionalities is lost as well.
fields.summary: The validation error message is not standardised across the Issue Screen components for the full-page and popup

fields.description:
This suggestion has been created from JRASERVER-3157 as a separate feature request because many of the activities requested in the original suggestion are already [tracked in the audit log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/auditing-in-jira-applications-938847740.html].  

We will use all the comments regarding the audit log from the original suggestion, so there is no need to put the same comments, just make sure to vote and watch the issue! We will provide further updates in here.

 
----
In Jira instances managed by a team of admins, tracking administrative events should cover all of the impactful activities. 
  
 The administration activities which need to be logged include changes to:
 * custom field context
 * issue type and issue type scheme
 * resolution
 * global system settings
fields.summary: Add events to the audit log in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Activity Streams feed from SDK has a project filter as recorded in  https://developer.atlassian.com/server/framework/atlassian-sdk/consuming-an-activity-streams-feed/ This currently doesn't work. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
(i) A quick way to test this is from the browser itself
# Make sure you have two projects with recent activities 
# Make sure you are logged into the Jira instance
# Update the URL as mentioned below:
{code}
http://baseurl/activity?streams=Project+IS+SSP
{code}

h3. Expected Results
It should return feed related to project SSP


h3. Actual Results
It returns feed related to all recently modified projects

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Activity Streams feed from SDK doesn't allow to restrict by project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the information on [Update project REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.12.0/?_ga=2.39423075.1967832540.1544403528-1198903000.1539825650#api/2/project-updateProject] is misleading. The Example provided includes *projectTypeKey* which indicates that this can be updated using this REST API call. However, that is incorrect and we will need to use [Update project type REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.12.0/?_ga=2.39423075.1967832540.1544403528-1198903000.1539825650#api/2/project-updateProjectType] to update project type.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the description of [Update project REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.12.0/?_ga=2.39423075.1967832540.1544403528-1198903000.1539825650#api/2/project-updateProject] to indicate that if we want to update the project type, we will need to use [Update project type REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.12.0/?_ga=2.39423075.1967832540.1544403528-1198903000.1539825650#api/2/project-updateProjectType].
fields.summary: Update REST API documentation for "Update project"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

During updating security tokens on dashboard there is an error "Unknown RPC service: update_security_token" which prevents from updating tokens. Moreover in case when first gadget on dashboard is not placed inside iframe the update phase isn't invoked at all. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Prepare a dashboard with plenty gadgets (some with auto-refresh)
 # Make sure first gadget is not embedded inside an iframe 
 # Check console.log(s) - messages that update token is no needed because there are no gadgets on dashboard should appear. 
 # Move your gadgets, make sure that iframe gadget is on first slot
 # Watch your console, errors about update_security_token should appear in a while (you can invoke the refresh function faster using ___st_refresh_ parameter eg. ?__st_refresh=4000)

h3. Expected Results
 * Jira should perform token updates for iframe gadgets in all cases - regardless of order
 * Jira should should successfully update security tokens for all gadgets inside iframe 

h3. Actual Results
 * Jira doesn't perform token updates in case when first gadget is outside an iframe
 * Jira throws an exception during token update when there is a mix of outside/inside iframe gadgets without auto-refresh.

h3. Notes

Issue is already fixed and will be shipped with Jira 8.0. 
h3. Workaround

There is not known workaround
fields.summary: Unknown RPC service: update_security_token

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira home page is sometimes not set when navigating to *Profile Icon > My Jira Home*.

h3. Environment
* Jira 7.13.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the *Profile Icon*, at the top right of Jira's UI
# Select one of the options from the section *My Jira Home*.

h3. Expected Results
* User's home page is correctly set every time.

h3. Actual Results
* Sometimes the home page is not set at all. When this happens, it's possible to assess the following:
** No network requests are made by the browser.
** There are no messages logged in the browser's console.
** Jira access logs do not show any requests to *{{/secure/UpdateMyJiraHome.jspa}}*.

h3.Workaround
Click once more on the desired option, as this often will result in the browser making the needed request to *{{/secure/UpdateMyJiraHome.jspa}}*.
fields.summary: Jira user home page is sometimes not changed when selecting it on the user's profile

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When user copied few paragraphs from a previewed PDF file and paste it in a text editor, the pasted text does not retain the formatting from the PDF file.

+Steps to reproduce+

# Login to JIRA version 7.6.X, 7.11.X & 7.12.X, JIRA 7.13
# Attach a pdf document
# Click the document to preview the PDF file from JIRA
# Try copying the paragraph or few lines from the preview and try to paste it to a text editor.

 !Testing Screenshot.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.6, JIRA 7.11, JIRA 7.12, 7.13


h3. Expected Results

When pasting the copied content everything is copied fine with line breaks.


h3. Actual Results

When pasting the content the line break is ignored.


h3. Workaround

Download the PDF file, open it from a different PDF reader, copy the text and paste the text to a text editor.
fields.summary: Problem with copying text from PDF preview

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bubble Chart gadget shows "Opps - an error occured" message

h3. Environment
Jira Software Standalone and Data Center Editions

h3. Steps to Reproduce

There are no steps to reproduce. This issue is intermittent and happens when an automatic comment is added to a jira issue on failing to attach an image.
If such a comment is present on a JIRA issue, it's 'author' column value in the 'jiraaction' table will be 'NULL' (which is incorrect)

h3. Expected Results

The bubble chart should ignore comments when their 'author' value in jiraaction table, column 'author' is set to NULL and still render correctly

h3. Actual Results

Bubble Chart stops rendering correctly and shows the following error:

"Opps - an error occurred" message on the chart

The below error is shown on the affected issue comment:
{noformat}
Anonymous added a comment - An error occurred while adding attachments to this issue from the source email. Please check the attachments and re-send the email.
{noformat}

The following exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log:
{noformat}

h3. Notes
The issue is random and the root cause of the issue is unknown yet, in most cases JIRA will not auto comment on failed attachments, but under unknown set of circumstances it will
 
h3.Workaround

1) Confirm if you're affected by this issue by checking if there any entries in 'jiraaction' table with 'author' value set to NULL.
Run the following SQL query in the JIRA database:

{code}
select * from jiraaction where author is null;
{code}

If there are any entries there -- please take a note of the entries IDs and proceed to step 2

2) Delete the offending entries from the jiraaction table:

{code}
delete from jiraaction where id in ('issue ID1', 'Issue ID2');
{code}

where issue ID1, Issue ID2 - are the entry IDs determined in step 1 above

Expected Results A SSL connection h3. Actual Results The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file: {noformat} 2018-12-06 14:23:37,738 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR [c.a.jira.health.HealthChecks] The server.xml file is missing parameters needed by Jira to handle requests that contain special characters. 2018-12-06 14:23:37,738 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR [c.a.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher] JIRA has failed to start because of the following errors: [(Event: Level = (EventLevel: error) , Key = (EventType: setup) , Desc = Tomcat is misconfigured , Exception = The server.xml file is missing parameters needed by Jira to handle requests that contain special characters.
)] {noformat} You will be presented with an error screen when trying to connect to Jira. !image-2018-12-07-14-42-22-590.png|thumbnail! h3. Workaround Please follow the instructions to manually update the {{server.xml}} file at [Changing server.xml to handle requests with special characters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-server-xml-to-handle-requests-with-special-characters-958453799.html]
fields.summary: Application configuration tool doesn't add for special characters (relaxedQueryChars)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On different pages there are different month abbreviations used in date displaying and date pickers.
h3. Environment

Jira Core 7.13.0, Jira Core 8.0.0-m0021
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start Jira Core 7.13.0 with: {{mvn amps:run-standalone -Dproduct=jira -Dproduct.version=7.13.0}}
 # Setup Jira with defaults and create sample project and issue
 # Got to user preferences and switch language to: Deutsch (Deutschland)
 # Navigate to sample issue detailed view (e.g. [http://localhost:2990/jira/browse/DEMO-1)]
 # Click Edit and set due date to 10.03.2019. After selecting in date picker the input value is *10/Mrz/19* (screenshot1)
 # Save Issue. On issue view you can see due date as *10/Mär/19* (screenshot2)
 # Go to project versions administration view (e.g. [http://localhost:2990/jira/plugins/servlet/project-config/DEMO/administer-versions?status=unreleased)]
 # Add new version with start date equal;l to 10.03.2019. After selecting in date picker the input value is *10/mär/19*. (screenshpot3)
 # Save version. On version list you can see start date as *10/Mär/19* (screenshot4)

h3. Expected Results

Different pages and components use different formats: *10/Mrz/19,*  *10/Mär/19,* ***10/mär/19*
h3. Actual Results

All dates in Jira system for logged-in user should use the same format, language and month names/abbreviations. E.g. Jira should use everywhere on pages and in components: *10/Mär/19*
h3. Workaround

None
h3. Quick investigation

*On Jira issue view:*
 {{console.log(Calendar._SMN) > ["Jan", "Feb", "Mrz", "Apr", "Mai", "Jun", "Jul", "Aug", "Sep", "Okt", "Nov", "Dez"]}}

*On project versions administration view:*
 {{console.log(Calendar._SMN) > ["Jan", "Feb", "Mär", "Apr", "Mai", "Jun", "Jul", "Aug", "Sep", "Okt", "Nov", "Dez"]}}
fields.summary: Wrong month abbreviations used for Deutsch language on different pages

fields.description:
h3. Task
I want to control which third party applications can access my Jira Server, both by white- or blacklisting. Thus only applications that are deemed trustworthy can access my Jira Server.  

h3. How it could work
* An app must be signed by a valid vendor key and a valid key specific to this application to be able to access the Rest API. 
* Jira admins can black or white list apps or a vendor (covering all apps of this vendor, existing and future).
* Access to Rest API is allowed only on basis of the black or white listings; or to all and everybody, if both are empty.

This would definitly be an infrastructure project, but it will appeal to corporations or organisations where more control over their system than usually is needed.

(!) This would be something worth considering across the whole product stack of Atlassian.
fields.summary: Controll access to Rest API

h3. Summary
The tooltip to display the full name of a long workflow transition is not visible when mouse is hovered on the button (issue view screen)

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new, long workflow transition on a draft workflow. (!) Make sure you keep a copy in case anything goes wrong. For example - *Thisisaverylongnameforatransition*
 !workflow_transition.png|thumbnail! 
# Once published, navigate to the issue view screen of any issues under the project were the workflow transition was included
# You will notice that the long name is truncated. Hover to the button to display the full name of the workflow

The tooltip of the long workflow should display the full name of the workflow transition. For example:
 !long_name_tooltip.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
No tooltip is displayed when you hover to the workflow button
 !issue_view_screen_bug.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No available workarounds so far

fields.description:
This issue is similar to JRASERVER-63137 in symptom (but likely a slightly different cause).

We have 3 nodes in a Jira cluster. We saw CPU increase and plateau on one node, and then each other node increased as well:
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-05 at 10.38.34 AM.png|thumbnail! 

Thread dumps show lots of RMI TCP Connection threads 'stuck waiting for response from external systems' (see attached thread dumps, run them through fastthread.io).

This appears to indicate an issue with the cache replication. There were no user reports of incorrect cached data however.

There _were_ reports of timeouts and slowness processing requests, which would be expected with CPU this high. Without performing a restart when we had, this issue would have caused a full system outage.

h3. Workaround
Perform a rolling restart of the cluster (bring each node down and back up before bringing the next node down). CPU will drop back to normal.
fields.summary: Cluster cache replication can cause high CPU across all nodes in the cluster and require a restart
